Generation I.Red: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pok é mon will fiercely peck at any intruder.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pok é mon will fiercely peck at any intruder.
Generation I.Yellow: This Pok é mon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.
Generation I.Stadium: It builds its nest in the center of its large territory. It uses its powerfully-developed talons to swiftly snatch prey.

Generation II.Gold: It has outstanding vision. However high it flies, it is able to distinguish the movements of its prey.
Generation II.Silver: It immobilizes its prey using well-developed claws, then carries the prey more than 60 miles to its nest.
Generation II.Crystal: It slowly flies in a circular pattern, all the while keeping a sharp lookout for prey.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It has outstanding vision. However high it flies, it is able to distinguish the movements of its prey. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It immobilizes its prey using well-developed claws, then it carries the prey more than 60 miles to its nest. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This Pok é mon flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.

Generation III.FireRed: The claws on its feet are well developed. It can carry prey such as an Exeggcute to its nest over 60 miles away.
